thread.title: Texas A&M-Nevada notebook: Brandon Williams becomes Aggies' first two-way player since '60's
thread.title_full: Texas A&M-Nevada notebook: Brandon Williams becomes Aggies' first two-way player since '60's | Dallas Morning News

author: Kate Hairopoulos
title: Texas A&M-Nevada notebook: Brandon Williams becomes Aggies' first two-way player since '60's
text:
COLLEGE STATION â” Texas A&M senior Brandon Williams made a cameo appearance on offense in Saturday's 44-27 win over Nevada, becoming the first Aggies two-way player since 1968.
The converted cornerback returned to his roots at running back, taking a handoff for a 3-yard gain in the first quarter and also catching a pass for 3 yards in the second quarter.
He recorded 2 1/2 tackles on defense, which he switched his focus to during the spring season.
The most recent two-way A&M players, according to the school, were All-America defensive back Dave Elmendorf and Ross Brupbacher.
Williams said he started getting more reps on offense in practice this past week.
A&M's depth at running back has taken a hit with an undisclosed injury to James White in the season opener against Arizona State.
Starting running back Tra Carson had 22 carries for a career-high 137 yards.
"Brandon, that's my boy, you know," Carson said. "He's welcome to come back anytime."
Timely pick: Sophomore safety Donovan Wilson made the first interception of his career on Nevada's first play of the second half.
Wilson snagged the ball at Nevada's 28, setting up an A&M touchdown four plays later to give the Aggies a 31-10 lead.
Aggies return from injuries, suspensions: Senior defensive tackle Julien Obioha made his season debut after undergoing an appendectomy during preseason camp.
Defensive tackle Zaycoven Henderson and linebacker A.J. Hilliard returned after two-game suspensions for unspecified violations of athletic department rules. Hilliard led A&M with eight tackles, including two tackles for loss and a sack. Hilliard, a TCU transfer, played in just his first game for A&M since suffering a season-ending injury in the 2014 season opener.
Punter Drew Kaser returned after missing the previous week's win over Ball State. He averaged 52.5 yards on four punts, including two downed inside the Nevada 20.
Linebacker Josh Walker (undisclosed injury) did not play.
Electric Kirk: Freshman receiver Christian Kirk grabbed six catches for a game-high 120 yards, his second 100-yard game in his three-game career. He leads A&M with 16 catches for 269 yards.
Steady Bertolet: Senior kicker Taylor Bertolet is perfect on field goals and PATs this season after missing a combined 10 PATs in 2012 and 2013. He made three field goals Saturday of 32, 21 and 37 yards.
